question: In which nation the amphitheatre "Pula Arena" is located?
explanation: Pula Arena is an ancient Roman amphitheatre constructed in 27 B.C. - 68 A.D. located in Croatia during the periods of the Roman Empire. It is the only remaining Roman amphitheatre to have four side towers and with all three Roman architectural orders entirely preserved. It is one among the world's sixth-largest surviving Roman arenas.
